result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Prison sentence serving in Trempealeau County Case No. 11CF75.
Concurrent with: Probation ordered in 16CF217.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment approved by his agent.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with Eric Emerson or Susan Bauer, or their residences.  No contact with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  Obey all no contact orders of his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Obtain housing approved by his agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:37 PM  Due to COVID19 pandemic the following participants are appearing by video/phone by Zoom: Judge Goodman,  Prosecuting attorney Emily Hynek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Christopher L. Martin appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail, Attorney Stephanie K. Osborne appeared by video for Christopher L. Martin. Defendant wishes to proceed today via zoom video.  Parties have the revocation packet.  State recommended:  298 days.  Find time served.  Defense requested the court to adopt the agent's recommendation.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  298 days jail.  Find time served.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 9, 2021 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Prior.  14CF83, defendant plead no contest to count 1.  16CF217, defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Remaining counts in that case are dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court advised the elements and possible penalties in the counts the defendant plead to.  He understood.  Court gave felony warnings to the defendant.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, contrary to 961.41(3g)(am), as a repeater, and Possession of Methamphetamine, contrary to 961.41(3g)(g) as party to the crime, repeater.   Joint recommendation for 4 years probation, concurrent, but consecutive to any sentence now serving (concurrent with probation ordered on that sentence).  AODA and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  s/m employment.  commensurate with his treatment needs.  No contact with S.B. or E.E. or any other known drug users or dealers.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 4 years probation, concurrent, but consecutive to the prison sentence now serving 11CF75 Tremp Co. (concurrent with probation ordered on that sentence).  AODA and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Seek and maintain full time employment,  approved by his agent.  Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  Obtain housing agent approves.  No contact with S.B. or E.E. or their residences.  Obey or any no contact orders by his agent,  or any known drug users or dealers.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Any credit to be determined.  File a written stipulation with the Judge.
